pullRequest.body:
Use "\mapsto" instead, which is preferred by the style guide.

-----------

This PR is not exhaustive, but about halves the number of occurrences. I may submit follow-up PRs.

Not built locally (but if everything went right, it should all build). Delegation could help; this is extremely prone to merge conflicts.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [a46596e57d](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19576/commits/a46596e57d139a2c10acf773e3fccac312c664a2)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ instance (S : L.Substructure M) : L.OrderedStructure S := ⟨fun x ↦ relMap_leSymb (S.subtype ∘ x)⟩`
`+ instance (s : Set α) : CoeTC s α := ⟨fun x ↦ x.1⟩`
`+ instance : CoeFun (SmoothBumpCovering ι I M s) fun x ↦ ∀ i : ι, SmoothBumpFunction I (x.c i)`
`+ instance : CoeFun G.Connected fun _ => ∀ u v : V, G.Reachable u v := ⟨fun h ↦ h.preconnected⟩`
`+ instance : HasCompl (Clopens α) := ⟨fun s ↦ ⟨sᶜ, s.isClopen.compl⟩⟩`
`+ instance : Hashable Char := ⟨fun c ↦ hash c.1⟩`
`+ instance : Inv ℝ≥0∞ := ⟨fun a ↦ sInf { b | 1 ≤ a * b }⟩`
`+ instance : IsEmpty (Language.order.Relations 0) := ⟨fun x ↦ by cases x⟩`
`+ instance : Neg (Poly α) := ⟨fun f ↦ ⟨-f, f.2.neg⟩⟩`
`+ instance : Neg ℍ[R,c₁,c₂] := ⟨fun a ↦ ⟨-a.1, -a.2, -a.3, -a.4⟩⟩`
`+ instance : Norm ℤ_[p] := ⟨fun z ↦ ‖(z : ℚ_[p])‖⟩`
`+ instance : SuccAddOrder NatOrdinal := ⟨fun x ↦ (nadd_one x).symm⟩`
`+ instance : ToFormat Ineq := ⟨fun i ↦ Ineq.toString i⟩`
`+ instance {α : Type*} {s : Set α} : CoeHead (Set s) (Set α) := ⟨fun t ↦ (Subtype.val '' t)⟩`
`- instance (S : L.Substructure M) : L.OrderedStructure S := ⟨fun x => relMap_leSymb (S.subtype ∘ x)⟩`
`- instance (s : Set α) : CoeTC s α := ⟨fun x => x.1⟩`
`- instance : CoeFun (SmoothBumpCovering ι I M s) fun x => ∀ i : ι, SmoothBumpFunction I (x.c i)`
`- instance : CoeFun G.Connected fun _ => ∀ u v : V, G.Reachable u v := ⟨fun h => h.preconnected⟩`
`- instance : HasCompl (Clopens α) := ⟨fun s => ⟨sᶜ, s.isClopen.compl⟩⟩`
`- instance : Hashable Char := ⟨fun c => hash c.1⟩`
`- instance : Inv ℝ≥0∞ := ⟨fun a => sInf { b | 1 ≤ a * b }⟩`
`- instance : IsEmpty (Language.order.Relations 0) := ⟨fun x => by cases x⟩`
`- instance : Neg (Poly α) := ⟨fun f => ⟨-f, f.2.neg⟩⟩`
`- instance : Neg ℍ[R,c₁,c₂] := ⟨fun a => ⟨-a.1, -a.2, -a.3, -a.4⟩⟩`
`- instance : Norm ℤ_[p] := ⟨fun z => ‖(z : ℚ_[p])‖⟩`
`- instance : SuccAddOrder NatOrdinal := ⟨fun x => (nadd_one x).symm⟩`
`- instance : ToFormat Ineq := ⟨fun i => Ineq.toString i⟩`
`- instance {α : Type*} {s : Set α} : CoeHead (Set s) (Set α) := ⟨fun t => (Subtype.val '' t)⟩`
`-+-+ Continuous_add`
`-+-+ coeFn_posPart`
`-+-+ coe_pi`
`-+-+ coe_vaddConst`
`-+-+ comp`
`-+-+ comp'`
`-+-+ comp₁`
`-+-+ const_max`
`-+-+ const_min`
`-+-+ continuous_neg`
`-+-+ differentiable_cos`
`-+-+ differentiable_cosh`
`-+-+ differentiable_sin`
`-+-+ differentiable_sinh`
`-+-+ div_def`
`-+-+ drop`
`-+-+ encode_iff`
`-+-+ hasSum_coe`
`-+-+ hasSum_conj`
`-+-+ hasSum_conj'`
`-+-+ hasSum_im`
`-+-+ hasSum_re`
`-+-+ image_id'`
`-+-+ inv_def`
`-+-+ isBigO_id`
`-+-+ isCauSeq_im`
`-+-+ isCauSeq_re`
`-+-+ max_const`
`-+-+ min_const`
`-+-+ nhds_zero_basis`
`-+-+ norm`
`-+-+ summable_coe`
`-+-+ summable_conj`
`-+-+ toEquiv`
`-+-+ uIcc_injective_right`
`-+-+-+ coe_mulRight`
`-+-+-+ option_some_iff`
`-+-+-+-+ map`
`-+-+-+-+ map_id'`
`-+-+-+-+ tail`
`-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+ canLift`
`--++ deriv_cos'`
`--++ hasSum_ofReal`
`--++ iInfKerProjEquiv`
`--++ locallyFinite_tsupport`
`--++ nil`
`--++ summable_ofReal`
`--++-+ coe_inl`
`----++++ locallyFinite`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
The diff is `+20,658 −20,659`; can you locate the one surplus deleted line, and restore it or comment on it in the github UI?
The `MathlibTest` commit is the one with the imbalance. ~~Can comment more in 1-2 hours.~~Never mind, found it.

:v: grunweg can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Note that merging this PR will create conflicts in every open PR that moves files around; and they'll be painful enough that people might resort to resolving them badly, causing lemmas from other PRs to be dropped.

So if we want this, we should minimize the number of open "move" / "split" PRs first, and then rerun the script you hopefully used to generate this.

bors d-
I would like more consensus before this proceeds.
I would like more consensus before this proceeds.
This line causes the mismatch in the diff. Not sure why this happened... auto-save?
For the record: I'd land the test changes separately, and also change `Archive` and `Counterexamples` separately. This should shrink the size of this PR, and allow staggering dealing with conflicts.

pullRequest.title: chore: replace many occurrences of `=>` arrows for anonymous functions
